page.title: 07LUCKINGTON SCHOOL.
page.content: Luckington County Primary School is a two teacher village school.There are 24 children in the school.The school is housed in one large Victorian building and an adjacent Pratten building.The Pratten building is used by the local Playgroup and also acts as the dining room for the school children.Outside there are grassed areas,flower beds,a pond and two playgrounds,as well as two storage sheds and a garage. Most of the schoolchildren live in the village or in nearby Alderton.At one time the headmaster lived in the rooms above the ground floor;these are now the school office and stock rooms.The school meals are brought in daily from Hullavington School. The school hours are from 9.00 to 12.15 and 1.15 to 3.15.
